title: AMS Culture Rules: Behavior That Makes the System Work
hook: Processes don’t fail first in SAP AMS. Behavior does. Culture is the invisible control plane.
idea: Modern AMS culture is not motivational slogans. It’s a small set of enforced rules that shape decisions under pressure, across vendors, tools, and hierarchies.

non_negotiable_rules.means: No escalation, blame, or payment dispute without logs, IDs, timestamps, and signals.
Shared responsibility exists, but accountability never is.
A repeated incident without a Problem record is an AMS process defect.
If rollback is unclear, speed is not allowed.
Acceptance requires verification, not lack of complaints.

during_incidents: Name the next action and owner
during_changes: Test the thing that can break, not everything

what_is_explicitly_blocked: VIP bypass of intake and gates

process: Gates that physically block bad behavior
Boards that expose rot and repetition
incentives: Neutral treatment of honest bad news

copilot_moves: Flag behavior violations (missing owner, missing evidence).
Highlight repeated shortcuts and their cost.
Reinforce rules in chat prompts and templates.

why_this_scales: Rules apply equally to internal teams and vendors.
New people learn the system fast.
AMS quality becomes predictable, not heroic.
design_question: What behavior would break the system fastest if we allowed it?
